Posts.Content: I first had breast cancer in 2011.i had a lumpectomy, 6 sessions of chemo and 25 sessions of radiotherapy and was put onto tamoxifen. I thought that was it - how wrong was I. 4 weeks ago I was diagnosed with breast cancer in the other breast doc said only 7% chance of getting it so I now count myself as unlucky. Only good thing it was caught very early and not in the nodes. I had a lumpectomy 3 weeks ago, very sore  under my arm ,still exhausted all the time and very weapy, I also struggle to sleep at night. I start Radiotherapy ( 20 sessions) in Aug as I have to go back to South Africa and put up the memorial stone for my mom who passed away in August 2017. What a year I have had.  Any  tips on coping with Radiotherapy, feeling tired and down.  I work in a school so gong back on Monday till end of term however I am not sure I am ready. I really don’t know if I have fituge or is is it’s the effects from the operation. Have I not given myself enough time to heal, if not how long does it take to heal.  Any advice and help appreciate
Posts.Title: Brest cancer returned in other breast

Posts.Content: Well today was the start of Radiotherapy therapy for me  one down only 19 to go. Got the creams and deodorant but  looking for any other tips to help - what worked well for you, can anyone can advise me how to the next few week easier. thanks inadvance

Posts.Content: Thanks for the tips I am new here however I did have breast cancer 7 years ago and it came back in the other breast . Had chemo before but lucky this time i don’t need it. Hopefully the side effects won’t be to bad thanks again
